summary: This document is an email chain from May 3, 2021, regarding a victim services request. A victim contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking assistance and participation in the investigation of the Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein cases. The email confirms the ongoing prosecution of Maxwell and notes Epstein's death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the case 'United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell' being prosecuted in the Southern District of New York for charges including enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the defendant in the case 'United States vs. Jeffrey Epstein', who was arrested and died by suicide while in confinement, involved in sex trafficking and sexual exploitation of children.

connections.description: Both are defendants in related federal cases for sex trafficking and exploitation of minors, with Maxwell being prosecuted and Epstein deceased.

events.title: Victim Services Request Email
events.description: A victim sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office requesting assistance and participation in the investigation of the Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein cases.

events.title: Arrest and Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and later died by suicide while in confinement.

events.title: Ongoing Prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The case 'United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell' is confirmed as being actively prosecuted in the Southern District of New York.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A victim reached out to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on May 3, 2021, seeking to participate in the investigation of the Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein cases.
The case 'United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell' was actively being prosecuted, with charges including enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.
Jeffrey Epstein was confirmed to have died by suicide while in confinement after his arrest.
The correspondence indicates the victim had previously spoken to law enforcement and mandatory reporters about the crimes.
The email chain involves internal forwarding between U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the victim's request.
